Comment: I live in Washington State. The last time this shit happened: "Border ambiguity The Oregon Treaty of June 15, 1846, resolved the Oregon boundary dispute by dividing the Oregon Country/Columbia District between the United States and Britain (future Canada) "along the 49th parallel of north latitude to the middle of the channel which separates the continent from off-shore Vancouver Island, and thence southerly through the middle of the said channel, and of the Strait of Juan de Fuca, to the Pacific Ocean."[1]  However, two straits could be called the middle of the channel: Haro Strait, along the west side of the off-shore San Juan Islands; and Rosario Strait, along the east side.[2]"  1846. Do you understand how atavistic this bullshit is? We call these the Pig Wars. Literally wars over a pig.  Same thing now, only the pig is motherfucking Orange.
Author: Mindless-Pogram

Comment: Sigh.   The headline is completely wrong. It’s not the tariffs that are the problem.  It’s the threat to Canadas sovereignty.  Headlines and stories like this which ignore that just make the situation worse.  Canada wants Americans to acknowledge that Trump is completely wrong to suggest that Canada should be the 51st state and that they do not condone what he says.

Comment: I'm conflicted.  On the one hand, we need to keep alive the personal relationships between ordinary people, to maintain goodwill until after Trump is gone, when presumably there will again need to be a reset.  On the other hand, folks in Saginaw voted for this, and we will not change their minds until they feel in their own homes and pocketbooks the consequences of Trump's destruction. As such, Canadian sports teams should be shunning American teams, and absolutely not traveling to the US, to send a clear signal that "business as usual" is over, and America will need to win back the trust of Canada, if that is even achievable.
